intro: Psiadia coronopus, commonly known as the crownwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small, white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Psiadia coronopus is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
